abstract: Creates an empty, invalid column used to remove an existing column from a data table.

codeExamples.code:
let data: [String: MLDataValueConvertible] = [
    "Day": ["Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday"],
    "Temperature": [91.3, 85.8, 79.5, 83.4, 72.2]
]

var table = try MLDataTable(dictionary: data)

print(table)
/* Prints...
 Columns:
 Day    string
 Temperature    float
 Rows: 5
 Data:
 +----------------+----------------+
 | Day            | Temperature    |
 +----------------+----------------+
 | Monday         | 91.3           |
 | Tuesday        | 85.8           |
 | Wednesday      | 79.5           |
 | Thursday       | 83.4           |
 | Friday         | 72.2           |
 +----------------+----------------+
 [5 rows x 2 columns]
 */

// Remove the "Temperature" column from the data table
table["Temperature"] = emptyColumn

print(table)
/* Prints...
 Columns:
 Day    string
 Rows: 5
 Data:
 +----------------+
 | Day            |
 +----------------+
 | Monday         |
 | Tuesday        |
 | Wednesday      |
 | Thursday       |
 | Friday         |
 +----------------+
 [5 rows x 1 columns]
 */

overview:
## Return Value

An empty, invalid column.

## Discussion

Use this initializer to create an empty column that, when assigned to the name of an existing column within a data table, will remove that column from the table.

For example, to remove a column from a data table, first start with a variable data table.

Then use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn/init()] to create an empty column.

Finally, use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn/subscript(_:)-9hr32] to remove the existing column from the data table by setting the empty column to the name of that existing column.

# init()

**Initializer**

Creates an empty, invalid column used to remove an existing column from a data table.

## Declaration

```swift
init()
```

## Return Value

An empty, invalid column.

## Discussion

Use this initializer to create an empty column that, when assigned to the name of an existing column within a data table, will remove that column from the table.

For example, to remove a column from a data table, first start with a variable data table.

```swift
let data: [String: MLDataValueConvertible] = [
    "Day": ["Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday"],
    "Temperature": [91.3, 85.8, 79.5, 83.4, 72.2]
]

var table = try MLDataTable(dictionary: data)

print(table)
/* Prints...
 Columns:
 Day    string
 Temperature    float
 Rows: 5
 Data:
 +----------------+----------------+
 | Day            | Temperature    |
 +----------------+----------------+
 | Monday         | 91.3           |
 | Tuesday        | 85.8           |
 | Wednesday      | 79.5           |
 | Thursday       | 83.4           |
 | Friday         | 72.2           |
 +----------------+----------------+
 [5 rows x 2 columns]
 */
```

Then use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn/init()] to create an empty column.

```swift
let emptyColumn = MLUntypedColumn()
```

Finally, use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn/subscript(_:)-9hr32] to remove the existing column from the data table by setting the empty column to the name of that existing column.

```swift
// Remove the "Temperature" column from the data table
table["Temperature"] = emptyColumn

print(table)
/* Prints...
 Columns:
 Day    string
 Rows: 5
 Data:
 +----------------+
 | Day            |
 +----------------+
 | Monday         |
 | Tuesday        |
 | Wednesday      |
 | Thursday       |
 | Friday         |
 +----------------+
 [5 rows x 1 columns]
 */
```

## Creating an untyped column

- **init(repeating:count:)**: Creates a new column with a repeating value.
- **init(repeating:count:)**: Creates a new column with a repeating value.
- **init(repeating:count:)**: Creates a new column with a repeating value.
- **init(_:)**: Creates a new column of integers from a given closed range.
- **init(_:)**: Creates a new column of integers from a given range.
- **init(_:)**: Creates a new column of integers from a given closed range.
- **init(_:)**: Creates a new column from a given sequence of elements that can be converted to machine learning data values.
- **init(_:)**: Creates a new column from a given sequence of machine learning data values.
